title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 10.3 - Internet Pre-Licensing Sponsor Requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 10.3 - Internet Pre-Licensing Sponsor Requirements

State Regulations
(a) No person shall administer a
pre-licensing course using the internet without prior approval from the

Commissioner. (b) Approved sponsors
shall be permitted to use the internet to administer a pre-licensing course. Internet pre-licensing courses may only be administered during the period
provided for in Article 12-D of the Vehicle and Traffic Law. (c) Sponsors must obtain confirmation from
each student that such individual possesses a valid photo learner's permit, and
sponsors must not enroll any individual in an internet pre-licensing course
that does not provide such confirmation. (d) Sponsors shall be responsible for the
delivery and administration of the course. Sponsors shall also be responsible
for compliance with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and policies
relative to this course. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
10.3

Adopted

New

York State Register June 17, 2020/Volume XLII, Issue 24, eff. 6/17/2020

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
